“Attachment bursts” → rate limit problems, retries storm, cascading failures
Attachments + non-text messages break classification and can cause “payload too large” failures
1) Automation loops that spam customers or endlessly re-trigger your middleware
Order status automation pitfalls (wrong order, missing order, privacy leaks) + safe fallback
“We send too much conversation context” → LLM context overflow, slow classification, higher misroutes
Duplicate events and idempotency failures (double replies, double routing, double tagging)
“We can’t fetch the attachment later” → broken automation due to expiring URLs / auth / bad content-types
Assuming Richpanel will “retry later” if your HTTP Target fails
Weak handling of “normal” Richpanel API errors (not just rate limits)
“We accidentally inline the attachment” (base64 blobs or huge HTML) → requests blow up / 413 errors
LLM classification failures (multi-intent, vague messages, and prompt-injection)
Team/department mapping drift (your router sends tickets to the wrong place over time)

Pagination mistakes = missing teams/tags/users, which breaks routing in subtle ways
A practical dev checklist to prevent most of these at once
